info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:24AM AST until April 20 at 3:15PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by flood waters from Rio Cibuco due to excess runoff.
* WHERE...Vega Alta and Vega Baja.
* WHEN...Until 315 PM AST.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 917 AM AST, emergency management continued reporting flooding in the warned area due to flood waters from Rio Cibuco. Flooding is ongoing, causing road closures along PR-620 by Fatima bridge in Barrio Candelaria in Vega Alta and PR-2 near intersection with PR-690 in Vega Alta. Rio Cibuco is at action flood stage, however, it is rapidly reaching minor flood stage, with USGS sensors reporting streamflow now around 14.8 ft. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Vega Alta, PR; Vega Baja, PR
